had no legal claim to it. The SCA, which Zahi Hawass heads, said in an email that its request had been approved by both Prime Minister Ahmed Nazif and the Egyptian ministry of culture. This request is a natural consequence of Egypt's long-standing policy of seeking the restitution of all archaeological and historical artefacts that have been taken illicitly out of the country, it said.
